English: the family (as a whole including parents)
ASKING SOMEONE WHAT THEIR MARITAL STATUS IS
ASKING SOMEONE IF THEY HAVE CHILDREN

Irish: SAYING THAT YOU HAVE OR HAVEN'T CHILDREN

English: I have no children at all.
We have no children at all.
I have no children at all.
We have no children at all.

Irish: Tá mé ag súil le páiste.
Tá mé ag súil le leanbh.

English: ASKING SOMEONE HOW MEMBERS OF THEIR FAMILY ARE

Irish: Cad é mar atá do chlann?
English: How are your children? (when speaking to one person)

Irish: Cad é mar atá do chuid páistí?

English: This is how you return the question:

Irish: Cad é mar atá do chlannsa?
Cad é mar atá do chuid *páistíse*?

English: Note that the singular form of the noun is used after Cá mhéad?

Irish: Tá beirt acu ar an scoil.
English: Two of them are at school.

Irish: Tá duine amháin acu sa naíonra.
English: One of them is in playschool.
